csv_string_to_output.description: Convert either a string list, or a single string/int or an actual array of data to a list of dictionaries keyed with output_item
csv_string_to_output.label: csv_string_to_output
csv_string_to_output.name: csv_string_to_output

list_merge.description: Merge 2-10 different data paths into a single output data path. For example, if IP addresses are stored in the fields sourceAddress, destinationAddress, and deviceAddress, then those three fields could be merged together to form a single list of IP addresses.
list_merge.label: list_merge
list_merge.name: list_merge

artifact_create.description: Create a new artifact with the specified attributes. Supports all fields available in /rest/artifact. Add any unlisted inputs as dictionary keys in input_json. Unsupported keys will automatically be dropped.

fields.description: Container which the artifact will be added to.
fields.label: container
fields.name: container

fields.description: The name of the new artifact, which is optional and defaults to "artifact".
fields.label: name
fields.name: name

fields.description: The label of the new artifact, which is optional and defaults to "events"
fields.label: label
fields.name: label

fields.description: The severity of the new artifact, which is optional and defaults to "Medium". Typically this is either "High", "Medium", or "Low".
fields.label: severity
fields.name: severity

fields.description: The name of the CEF field to populate in the artifact, such as "destinationAddress" or "sourceDnsDomain". Required only if cef_value is provided.
fields.label: cef_field
fields.name: cef_field

fields.description: The value of the CEF field to populate in the artifact, such as the IP address, domain name, or file hash. Required only if cef_field is provided.
fields.label: cef_value
fields.name: cef_value

fields.description: The CEF data type of the data in cef_value. For example, this could be "ip", "hash", or "domain". Optional.
fields.label: cef_data_type
fields.name: cef_data_type

fields.description: A comma-separated list of tags to apply to the created artifact, which is optional.
fields.label: tags
fields.name: tags

fields.description: Either "true" or "false", depending on whether or not the new artifact should trigger the execution of any playbooks that are set to active on the label of the container the artifact will be added to. Optional and defaults to "false".
fields.label: run_automation
fields.name: run_automation

fields.description: Optional parameter to modify any extra attributes of the artifact. Input_json will be merged with other inputs. In the event of a conflict, input_json will take precedence.
fields.label: input_json
fields.name: input_json

artifact_create.label: artifact_create
artifact_create.name: artifact_create

advanced.description:
This uses the sender and renames the event to:

PP Message Delivered: Possible Phish from: <SENDER>

15.userCode:
# Write your custom code here...
    label=container.get('label')
    
    EMAIL_EVENT_TEMPLATE="PP Message Delivered: Possible Phish from: {0}"
    TAP_CLICK_EVENT_TEMPLATE="PP TAP Click Alert. Sender: {0}"
    
    # Adjust our template for the case name based on the label type
    TEMPLATE = TAP_CLICK_EVENT_TEMPLATE if label == "tap_click_event_automation" else EMAIL_EVENT_TEMPLATE
    
    sender = remove_null_emails_data___item[0] if remove_null_emails_data___item and len(remove_null_emails_data___item) > 0 else "unknown"
    
    
    event_name = TEMPLATE.format(sender)
    
    update = {
        "name":event_name
    }
    
    success, message = phantom.update(container, update)
    
    if not success:
        phantom.error(f'Failed to update container name. Message Returned: {message}')

regex_extract_email.description:
Provide a string with one or more email addresses in it to be extracted.
Can be helpful with strings from the To or CC fields of an email: "<other_email@domain.com>, 'Name' <e-mail@domain.com>"

fields.description: String containing email addresses
fields.label: input_string
fields.name: input_string

regex_extract_email.label: regex_extract_email
regex_extract_email.name: regex_extract_email

debug.description: Print debug messages with the type and value of 0-10 different inputs. This is useful for checking the values of input data or the outputs of other playbook blocks.
debug.label: debug
debug.name: debug

container_update.description: Allows updating various attributes of a container in a single custom function. Any attributes of a container not listed can be updated via the input_json parameter.

fields.description: Supports a container id or container dictionary
fields.label: container_input
fields.name: container_input

fields.description: Optional parameter to change container name
fields.label: name
fields.name: name

fields.description: Optional parameter to change the container description
fields.label: description
fields.name: description

fields.description: Optional parameter to change the container label
fields.label: label
fields.name: label

fields.description: Optional parameter to change the container owner. Accepts a username or role name or keyword "current" to set the currently running playbook user as the owner.
fields.label: owner
fields.name: owner

fields.description: Optional parameter to change the container sensitivity.
fields.label: sensitivity
fields.name: sensitivity

fields.description: Optional parameter to change the container severity.
fields.label: severity
fields.name: severity

fields.description: Optional parameter to change the container status.
fields.label: status
fields.name: status

fields.description: Optional parameter to change the container tags. Must be in the format of a comma separated list.
fields.label: tags
fields.name: tags

fields.description: Optional parameter to modify any extra attributes of a container. Input_json will be merged with other inputs. In the event of a conflict, input_json will take precedence.
fields.label: input_json
fields.name: input_json

container_update.label: container_update
container_update.name: container_update
